OXFORD UNIVERSITY PRESS, Inc.
417 FIFTH AVENUE, NEW YORK 16, N. Y.
TELEPHONE: OREGON 9-7300
16.March 1964
James A. Fellows, Assistant Director
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Avenue
Washington 36, D. C.
Dear Mr. Fellows:
In connection with your letter of 12 March, there is no
objection to your proposed use of Richard Eberhartâ€™s "For a i->ambn
so far as Oxford is concerned. However, we have definite control
only of rights in the United States, and I understand these are
the rights you least need.
We have accordingly sent your letter on to Mr. Eberhart1s
English publishers, Messrs. Chatto & Windus Ltd. of 40-42 William
IV Street, London W.C.2. I believe Messrs. Chatto & Windus control
rights throughout the rest of the world.
Yours sincerely
Allison Crane
Permissions Department
